name: Mini Glycolic Acid 7% Exfoliating and Brightening Daily Toner
description: Shop The Ordinary’s Glycolic Acid 7% Toning Solution at Sephora. This exfoliating toning solution contains seven percent glycolic acid.
ingredient: Glycolic Acid: An alpha hydroxy acid that exfoliates the skin.-Tasmanian Pepperberry Derivative: Helps reduce irritation associated with acid use.-Ginseng Root and Aloe Vera: Offer both visible radiance and soothing benefits.Aqua (Water), Glycolic Acid, Rosa damascena flower water, Centaurea cyanus flower water, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Water, Propanediol, Glycerin, Triethanolamine, Aminomethyl Propanol, Panax Ginseng Root Extract, Tasmannia Lanceolata Fruit/Leaf Extract, Aspartic Acid, Alanine, Glycine, Serine, Valine, Isoleucine, Proline, Threonine, Histidine, Phenylalanine, Glutamic Acid, Arginine, PCA, Sodium PCA, Sodium Lactate, Fructose, Glucose, Sucrose, Urea, Hexyl Nicotinate, Dextrin, Citric Acid, Polysorbate 20, Gellan Gum, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Sodium Chloride, Hexylene Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, 1,2-Hexanediol, Caprylyl Glycol.This formulation features a Tasmanian Pepperberry derivative, a plant extract that helps soothe the skin and reduce irritation commonly associated with exfoliation, making it suitable for frequent use. Additionally, the presence of this natural ingredient may cause seasonal color variation in the formula. With a carefully calibrated pH of approximately 3.6, the toner has an optimal balance between salt and acidity.
How to Use: Suggested Usage:Face/Neck Application: Apply once daily, ideally in the evening. Apply to the face and neck using a cotton pad or ﬁngers.Scalp Application: Apply to dry scalp, three times a week. Tilt your head back and use the nozzle to gently dispense product from the front to the back of the head in a sweeping motion. Massage well.Body Application (Strawberry Skin): Apply to rough, bumpy skin on the arms and legs - Keratosis Pilaris (sometimes referred to as KP or strawberry skin). Do not rinse oﬀ. Do not use on sensitive, peeling, or compromised skin. Avoid the eye contour and contact with eyes.If eye or skin irritation occurs, rinse thoroughly, cease use, and consult a physician. Use only as directed on unbroken skin. Patch testing prior to use is advised. Keep out of reach of children.Sunburn Alert: This product contains an alpha hydroxy acid (AHA) that may increase your skin’s sensitivity to the sun and particularly the possibility of sunburn. Use a sunscreen, wear protective clothing, and limit sun exposure while using this product and for a week afterwards.

name: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5 Hydrating Serum with Ceramides
description: Shop The Ordinary’s Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5 Hydrating Serum at Sephora. This hydrating serum has five forms of hyaluronic acid and added ceramides.
ingredient: Five forms of Hyaluronic Acid: Work different layers of skin’s surface to hold water.-Ceramides: Oil-like molecules combine to support the skin barrier, helping to keep water in.-Vitamin B5: Works within the skin moisture barrier to maintain it.Aqua (Water), Sodium Hyaluronate, Propanediol, Pentylene Glycol, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Sodium Hyaluronate Crosspolymer, Phospholipids, Sphingolipids, Panthenol, Ahnfeltiopsis Concinna Extract, Glycerin, Polysorbate 20, Citric Acid, Sodium Citrate, P-Anisic Acid, Tocopherol, Trisodium Ethylenediamine Disuccinate, Caprylyl Glycol, Ethoxydiglycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Hexylene Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin.This new formula has a slight yellow tinge when compared to our previous formula due to the addition of a ceramide blend. This is the natural colour of this new raw material.This formulation contains 5 types of hyaluronic acid, pro-vitamin B5 and ceramides.Ceramides:To lock in moisture and support the skin barrier, ensuring long-term hydration. Ceramides (a natural lipid found in the skin) enhance the barrier's ability to protect and hydrate and ensure that moisture is locked in for longer-term results.5 Types of Hyaluronic Acid:5 types of hyaluronic acid provide hydration to multiple layers of the skin. These include low-, medium-, and high-molecular-weight molecules, a hyaluronic acid crosspolymer, and hydrolyzed hyaluronic acid. These ingredients work together to help the skin retain moisture, re-plump dry, dehydrated areas, and improve skin suppleness.Pro-vitamin B5 (Panthenol):Supports the formation of essential skin barrier components like ceramides and fatty acids, further improving the skin's moisture retention and an overall healthy appearance.
How to Use: Suggested Usage:Apply a few drops to the face in the morning and evening.If irritation occurs, rinse off, cease use, and consult a physician.Use only as directed on unbroken skin.Patch testing prior to use is advised.Keep out of reach of children.Tip: Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5 and Squalane + Amino Acids Lip balm can be used together to hydrate and plump the lips. Apply 1-2 drops of Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5 on lips and follow with Squalane + Amino Acids Lip balm on top.Wet vs Dry Skin Use: Applying Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5 on wet or dry skin does not impact it’s efficacy, contrary to some people’s belief that HA should be applied on wet skin for best results. Applying a moisturizer on top is the key to getter better hydration results from Hyaluronic Acid 2% + B5.

reviews.name: Mahzeek
reviews.description: Okay, before writing this gifted review, I want to say I had already been using this product for a few weeks (purchased with my own money) so this review is 100% honest! Over the past year or so, I started noticing random small bumps on my skin that just wouldn’t go away, no matter how much AHA/BHA exfoliation, expensive skincare, or even Adapalene I used. Eventually, I decided to give Azelaic Acid a try but wanted something budget-friendly, and that’s when I found this one from The Ordinary. Not even kidding! Within just FIVE days of using it daily, I started seeing the bumps disappear and my skin felt calmer and less irritated. A few days later, I added vitamin C into the mix and the combo works like magic! My skin is noticeably smoother and brighter now. I didn’t have any issues with pilling btw. The key is to layer your products properly and start with the most liquidy textures first and work your way up to the thicker ones, letting each one absorb fully before moving on. This has a pretty thick consistency, but honestly, a little goes a long way! I absolutely love it. It’s become a staple in my routine!

reviews.description: skin concerns: combination skin, newly summer and more hormonal than usual and going through what i think is ‘second puberty’. extra insanely oily t-zone that had lots of little bumps and occasional tiny white heads that weren’t going away with aja’s, bha’s,. retinol helped a bit but was a bit harsh. niacinimide also helped a bit started using this at night with niacinimide/zinc from ordinary then this then a very light moisturizer and after i used it for the first time after a shower my skin the next morning was noticeably smoother less red and less irritated. the biggest difference i’ve seen with a product this far w these news problems. does have a funny smell but i like it in a weird way. has an almost matte powdery finish which is also unusual but i also like it in a weird way esp since ive been so greasy this summer its kind of refreshing to go to bed powdery smooth. i dont layer lots of products w it and i only use it at night. don’t see the need to also use it in the morning so i dont notice or care about pilling. i apply a pretty thin layer too. overall it doesn’t feel like a typical fancy product, but i really like it and ive been getting the results i was looking for. always worth trying for your skin then returning if not for you, since these things are so personal

name: Skin Perfecting 2% BHA Exfoliating Toner for Clear Skin
description: Shop Paula’s Choice’s Skin Perfecting 2% BHA Liquid Exfoliant at Sephora. This pore-purifying liquid removes dead skin and fights wrinkles.
ingredient: Salicylic Acid (BHA) 2%: Penetrates pores to clear blemish-causing buildup and shed dead skin. -Green Tea: A potent antioxidant that soothes irritated skin while improving visible signs of aging. -Methylpropanediol: Hydrates while visibly enhancing the skin’s glow and the formula’s penetration. Water (Aqua), Methylpropanediol, Butylene Glycol, Salicylic Acid, Polysorbate 20, Camellia Oleifera (Green Tea) Leaf Extract, Sodium Hydroxide, Tetrasodium EDTA.
How to Use: Suggested Usage:-Apply once or twice daily after cleansing.-Gently shake 1–2x onto hands or a cotton pad. -Apply to face and neck (avoid contact with your lash line and eyelids).-Do not rinse.-Follow with serum and/or moisturizer.-For daytime wear, always finish with SPF 30+.Start Slowly: Apply every other day and note skin's response. Then use up to twice daily. For daytime, always finish with SPF 30+. For nighttime, follow with the rest of your routine. If you have a salicylate allergy, check with your physician before using any products that contain salicylic acid.Recycling Instructions:Check your local recycling authority's guidelines.

It's not a miracle product and I haven't noticed pore shrinkage, but I will continue to use it to look for changes around my nose and cheek area.

reviewRating.itemReviewed: Money Mist Leave In Conditioner

reviews.name: dumplingsauce
reviews.description: This is the best hair product I’ve ever used hands down. I’ve had problem hair my entire life - baby fine and thin, oily, sensitive scalp, frizzy, uneven curl pattern and it’s only gotten worse with age because I’m now dealing with dryness and brittleness. I’ve relied on keratin for years just to not have to deal with it but I don’t like how stick straight and even more thin it makes my hair look. I’ve since let the keratin grow out and have been trying products with no luck until this product and I am truly impressed. A few spritz of this and the Dyson Airstraight and my hair becomes soft, manageable and has body in less than 10 minutes. It doesn’t make me greasy or weigh things down. I love the very light smell. This is a 100/10 product, I’m throwing everything else away and never looking back. Highly, highly recommended - only wish this came out years ago, would’ve saved me a lot of time, heartache, money and hair damage.

reviewRating.itemReviewed: Money Mist Leave In Conditioner

reviews.name: TheygwaNie
reviews.description: I really love this leave in conditioner. I have flat hair that's easily weighed down. I wash my hair every other day and use my Dyson to dry it. This works so well with a volume blowout and creates volume that is not sticky or heavy. It feels weightless but still provides a noticeable shine, softness, and gentle lift. I have already repurchased! I'm not giving it 5 stars because the first bottle only lasted 3 months, I don't like the smell, and the spray mechanism isn't my favourite, it's a "continuous spray" but I don't feel I have as much control over it as a traditional sprayer. Despite those things, I will probably continue to repurchase because finding a product that enhances volume and shine with no weigh down is difficult!
